meanings.definition: Obtain goods or services from an outside supplier
meanings.sent1: Our company decided to outsource the manufacturing of our products to a factory overseas.
meanings.sent2: Many businesses outsource their customer service to call centers in different countries.
meanings.sent3: I tried to outsource the task of doing my homework to my little brother, but he just played video games instead.
meanings.sent4: In order to focus on their core business, the company chose to outsource the IT support to a specialized firm.
meanings.sent5: The decision to outsource the delivery services saved the company a lot of time and money.

meanings.definition: Contract work out to an external company
meanings.sent1: The small business decided to outsource their website development to a web design agency.
meanings.sent2: Many startups outsource their marketing campaigns to agencies with expertise in digital advertising.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly told my friend I would outsource my chores to a robot if I could afford it.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to outsource the project management led to a successful and timely completion.
meanings.sent5: By outsourcing the payroll processing, the company was able to streamline their operations.

meanings.definition: Delegate tasks to a third party
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to outsource the event planning to a professional agency.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to outsource their accounting tasks to specialized firms.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could outsource my daily commute to someone else so I could relax on the way to work.
meanings.sent4: The decision to outsource the customer feedback analysis resulted in valuable insights for the company.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing the maintenance of the office equipment allowed the employees to focus on their main responsibilities.
